intro: Phyllanthus brynaertii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in savanna regions. It has a short stature, usually reaching only a few centimeters in height. The species is noted for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it an important component of its native ecosystems.
